lead_paragraph: Kieran Behan has overcome a botched leg operation and a brain injury that kept him from doing even the simplest things, like sitting or eating, to compete in three Olympic events.
snippet: Kieran Behan has overcome a botched leg operation and a brain injury that kept him from doing even the simplest things, like sitting or eating, to compete in three Olympic events....

headline.print_headline: Gymnast From Ireland Has Had Painful Road
headline.main: Once Told He’d Never Walk Again, Irish Gymnast Is Now Olympian
headline.seo: Kieran Behan of Ireland Competing in 3 Olympic Gymnastics Events

abstract: Profile of Irish gymnast Kieran Behan, who overcame a botched leg operation and a brain injury that kept him from doing even the simplest things, like sitting or eating, to compete at the 2012 Olympics.
